sequence:
The Royal Knight

<size=45>Chapter 4: After the Exercise...</size>

scripts.say: Several Days Later - Exercise Area
Ahem! Our success in these joint exercises is thanks entirely to your training, your implementation of the tactics you learned, and your ability to adapt to a changing combat situation.
In short, the Royal Navy seized victory not by random chance, but through the hard work and dedication of everyone here.
Now it is time to rest and recuperate. Indulge yourselves in the banquet Her Majesty has graciously bestowed upon us!
Aye-aye!
(I'll step out for some fresh air.)
(Ah? Who's that over there...?)
Enterprise?
Warspite? Congratulations. You won the exercise.
I'm still a little sore about it, honestly. I had my planes on you the whole time and I still didn't manage to sink you.
We should start calling you "The Unsinkable Legend."
(So it was you behind all those planes buzzing around my head...!)
(She kept me busy dodging bombs and firing ack-acks the whole time... I must've put on quite a show for the Commander...)
Hah. Thanks to you, I've had my fill of planes for a while.
You wore me out plenty yourself. Nothing like the splashes from 15-inch rounds right by your feet to keep you on your toes.
(... But not a single one of the shells I fired at Enterprise hit home. I guess she really is the "Lucky E".)
I really must thank you and the rest of the Eagle Union for participating in these exercises. The Royal Navy learned a lot from our war games today.
If we're thanking each other, I have to say it was great for the Union side too. I'd like it if we could keep up these large-scale exercises going forward.
And I look forward to sparring with you again, Warspite.
That feeling is certainly mutual.
Lady Warspite, I think Her Majesty is looking for you.
(Her Majesty...? Then I'd best hurry back.)
Then I won't keep you. Until next time!
Indeed. Farewell.
(And with that, my training assignment has come to an end, giving me a chance to rest a bit... I'll have to go enjoy the banquet with the girls. After I find out what Her Majesty wants, of course.)
